title: Toxic 'locker room culture' could be tackled with drive to make it as socially unacceptable as drink-driving
text:
Toxic "locker room culture" could be tackled with a drive to make it as socially unacceptable as drink-driving, the Victims' Commissioner for England and Wales has said.

Dame Vera Baird QC claimed rape victims currently face a "culture of disbelief" when trying to obtain justice due to a combination of myths and a drop in prosecutions.

She spoke out as record number of cases are reported to police.

Dame Vera said she is particularly disappointed by the conviction rate for reported rapes, despite the work of the #MeToo campaign in encouraging victims to come forward.

The former Northumbria police and crime commissioner also said some people's attitudes towards sexist language are similar to those around drink-driving in the 1970s.
description: Toxic "locker room culture" could be tackled with a drive to make it as socially unacceptable as drink-driving, the Victims' Commissioner for England and Wales has said.
